result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon M Heiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon M Heiller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Arrested by LCPD - def in custody

Signed by EML - 11 days CJ
Visions 03/03/2015 KP

11:08 am   Def in court w/ Atty Thomas F. Locante.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state has complied with victim notification.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.
12CF-588  Amended Complaint filed.  Count 2 - Attempted Fleeing an Officer  (Fel)  346.04(3)  GUILTY.  Count 3 - OWI -2nd  (BAC: .147)  346.44(1)(a)  GUILTY.  Counts 1, 4 & 5 - Dismissed but read-in
13CF-847  Count 1 - Fel Bail Jumping (drugs)  946.49(1)(b)  GUILTY.  Counts 2-5 - Dismissed but read-in
14CF-135  Count 3 - Fel Bail Jumping (new crime)  946.49(1)(b)  GUILTY.   Counts 1 & 2 - Dismissed but read-in
Right/elements/questions gone over.  No voting or firearms restriction advised.  Deportation advised.  Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Rights F & V waived.  Factual basis.  Accepts plea.  Found guilty and convicted.
Skemp:  He has a felony in Houston Co., MN which has mandatory prison time.  Asks that the revocations be concurrent.  Locante agrees w/Ms. Skemp that time served is appropriate.  Heiller comments.  Court comments.

SENTENCES:
Count 2 in 12CF-588 - 300 days CJ w/226 days credit; DL rev 6 mos; CC
Count 1 in 13CF-847 - 10 mos CJ w/226 days credit; CC
Count 3 in 14CF-135 - 10 mos CJ w/226 days credit; CC.

Count 3 in 12CF-588
$350 + cc =  $1,109 - apply cash bonds including the ones that were to be forfeited.
AA & DSP
DL rev 12 mos w/ IID for 12 mos
10 days CJ w/10 days credit

All sentences are concurrent and the DL revocations are concurrent.
Appeal rights advised.

From: Atty Locante Re: def doesn't want to plea now, take off calendar, trial 11/13 for earliest case.
Filed in 12CF588
From: Atty Locante Re: set for plea 10/6 @ 3:30
Per Hearing in 12CF588 - this file needs to be brough up for hearing
Jury selection on March 9, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Def w/atty Locante
Cash bond to remain $1000 to cover 13CF218,13CF847,14CF13 & 12CF588
from Atty Tom Locante   re: req for bond hrg on 8-8-14  @1:30  [filed in 13CF218]

Def w/atty Locante
  Probable cause found - boundover for trial
Information filed 
Def stands mute - NG plea entered
PTCDA: 8/1 @ 1:30
Status: 9/4 @ 10 (DTP)
Bond to cont

11 am   Def in court w/ Atty Thomas F Locante.  Def in custody.  John W Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Locante:  He miss his PH due to working out of State.  He has charges in Trempealeau Co.  This was gonna be a waiver but Mr. Heiller now doesn't want waive.  I told the State it would be a waiver so witnesses are not here.

PH:  7/7 at 11 am   DTP    Court finds good cause to beyond statutory time limits.

Locante asks the Court to reinstate the $1,000 cash bond and that it cover all case.  He also has an extradition to Minn.  Minser obj. to any change in the cash bond amount.  He has 5 open cases just in La Crosse Co.; number felony cases.  He has Trempealeau Co. cases and Minn. cases as well.

COURT thinks the bond that was set is appropriate.  The warrant was outstanding since March.  Multime BJ's and JS violations...  High risk...

State by Hynek  /  Def in custody w/ Atty Wright (for Locante)
Wright req cash bond posted be reinstated & not forfeited
CRT:  $1000 cash bond previously posted to remain w/ same conditions

State by Gruenke / Def in custody w/ Atty Wright (for Locante)
CRT:  Cash bond to remain
Prelim Hrg:  7-1-14 @ 11am w/ SLH

esigned EML
Visions 03/07/2014 KP

Forfeit bond.  Bench Warrant. $2,500 cash bond
